website_summaries.verdict: Finding a CHIRP-enabled fish finder at this price is great, and it’s small enough to work on a kayak as well as any personal boat.
pros: GPS system can save up to 5,000 spots
Excellent price for its feature set
Works well through rain or splashes

website_summaries.verdict: The best budget Garmin fish finder that comes with more expensive options in a smaller package.
pros: The device is small and easy to hold while fishing
Built-in sonar continuously updates the data screen for accurate information
Way point navigation is easy to access
cons: Connection cables are susceptible to interference and disruption

customer_reviews.title: READ OTHER REVIEWS BEFORE BUYING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This isn't 'portable' at all. I bought it for my kayak and stupid me didn't read all the reviews. First, it needs a 12v battery...or you can buy a nocqua battery pack for an extra $90+ with additional cables ($20). The mount doesn't have suction and can't be mounted to a kayak without purchasing additional mounting brackets ($35+). The screen isn't waterproof and doesn't appear to be well suited for taking out into saltwater where it may get splashed. It may be perfect for some pond fishing, but that's about it. All in, you'll spend over $240+ for this to get it powered and mounted. Needless to say, I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very simple and intuitive interface. It works just as ...
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and intuitive interface. It works just as I had hoped. However, there are two points that seem to be glossed over at times. First, this unit has to be connected to a 12 volt power supply such as a car battery or one of those car battery booster type units. So if you plan to use it in a kayak you need to plan for a power source. Second, the screen/keyboard unit is not water resistant at all. If there is a chance of rain or spray you need a ziplock bag or some such to cover the thing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised with my kayak.
customer_reviews.text: I do like this finder. It worked very well on it's maiden launch on my kayak. I paired it with the 141 transducer mounting arm track mount. I used a Outdoor Products Watertight Box to mount the 12V 7AH Sealed Lead Acid (SLA) Battery for Piranha MAX 160 Fish Finder inside with watertight switch. It was very clear display with good contrast. I like it's size and not in the way while paddling or fishing. The you can raise it up when landing/launching.
customer_reviews.author: simpletobelieve

customer_reviews.title: A lot of bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. It has a lot of features for such a small price including heading, bearing to waypoint, water temp, gps speed in statute miles or knots, distance to waypoint, eta to waypoint, current time, and ofcourse depth. I cannot speak as to the accuracy of finding fish as I use it solely for depth and navigation. I wish I had bought it a long time ago. One tip for anyone with a fiberglass hull: Bury the transducer in silicone at the bottom of your hull and avoid drilling holes in your boat. It is a cinch to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Newton

customer_reviews.title: and was super happy with it
customer_reviews.text: used this on a trip to canada, and was super happy with it. To not only have a fish finder to give you the correct depths, but to incorporate the GPS was great. It was super useful on unfamiliar water, because if you pay attention the 1st time you can follow your path to get home safely. Also, we used it to mark fish that we caught, and was able to use the split screen to pin point those spots and see depths. Pretty cool for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: KEN

customer_reviews.title: Do Your Research and Buy the Right Attachments Ahead of Time
customer_reviews.text: Not certain about tech support, but some directions for set up would have been nice. They included four different booklets with this fish finder and not one of them talked how to connect this thing up to a battery. A YouTube video from other customers simply isn’t acceptable. Paying to have someone install a $100 fish Finder, also not acceptable. I can learn how to connect the transducer to my boat in five languages though! In the end, my husband and I eventually got it figured out after an argument, a trip to Lowe’s, and another $15. It’s a good (maybe even a great) product - I’ll find out once I get it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Mjm579

customer_reviews.title: Even though it is spring it is still cold like winter but it felt good to be out
customer_reviews.text: Within hours of product delivery I was out on the water. Even though it is spring it is still cold like winter but it felt good to be out. Great product, Intuitive and easy to install. Word on the water is, the fish are nervous. 😁🎣 good news for the fish I let about 95% of them go. And just a friendly reminder to be on the lookout for the phantom dirt bag! He or she has been leaving their garbage behind for years and I never seem to catch them in the act.
customer_reviews.author: Uncledoobz

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my Sea Doo that I take fishing when I have to go by myself. Installed the xdcr in the hull and it works great, just don't get water temp because its mounted in the hull. Great to have on the Sea Doo to read depth and track lots of way points that are very easy to program.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for small boat installations that I could find and the price is also very hard to beat.
customer_reviews.text: Garmin makes one of the best small fish finder/GPS combination units that I could find for my small Sun Dolphin Sportsman Bass Boat. It has a lot of options and is very easy to set up for use. I mounted mine on a Scotty Base and it makes it very easy to take on and off the boat. Strongly recommend the Garmin Striker 4 for any small boat.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Coplin SR

customer_reviews.title: This unit is by far the best GPS fish finder i have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This unit is by far the best GPS fish finder i have ever owned. I owned half dozen of other units but none compare to this Striker 4. It is accurate, it reads the water depth while moving, it gives you so many options to view your water depth and your waypoint location. For the 110 dollars it costs, it is well worth more than that. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Albert O.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Sea Eagle inflatable boat!
customer_reviews.text: This works great on my Sea Eagle 285fpb inflatable boat, using a Brocraft adjustable transducer clamp-on bracket. I can run it all day on my ChromeBattery 12V 7AH- SLA battery. I haven't tested all the bells and whistles yet (GPS, speed, routes, etc.). I simply turn it on and use the default settings - it just works. Sensitivity and detail are really good. I highly recommend getting the Garmin plastic screen cover for it to protect it during rain and storage. My only complaint so far is the screen can be difficult to see under the sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kayak fishing
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit, for a great price. I just finished my first full season with the Striker 4 and it did not disappoint. The readings are accurate and the screen is colorful, bright & easy to read - even in direct sunlight. So far it's held up good to the sun, saltwater & sand and I'd highly recommend it to anyone looking for a lower priced depth finder.
customer_reviews.author: NRS052

customer_reviews.title: Great fishfinder
customer_reviews.text: Love this fishfinder. Great size and easy to use. Does everything very well.
customer_reviews.author: USAF Retiree

customer_reviews.title: An Old Man can operate this.
customer_reviews.text: I now own a Garmin fitness watch, a Garmin GPS for my car and this Garmin Fish Finder. Garmin products work and they are not difficult for an old geezer like me to understand how to operate. AND, they have EXCELLENT service people !!
customer_reviews.author: micurmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and compact fish finder!
customer_reviews.text: My son and I got this for our jon boat. We are very happy with this model. The clarity of the screen is excellent! We used marine grade silicone to mount the transducer on the hull so we didn’t have to drill as the boat is under warranty. We found so many fish with this and the GPS worked great! Highly recommend for smaller boats!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I seem to be having some problems with it that ...
customer_reviews.text: I seem to be having some problems with it that Garmin never heard of. Also they said the "chirp" transducer was not full "Chirp" and you have to upgrade the transducer. If I had known that I would not have bought it. Now it's installed it's too much trouble to change. Wish I had known.
customer_reviews.author: bill giesker

customer_reviews.title: I plan on sending it back to Amazon and getting a better one.
customer_reviews.text: Installed it and used once and then screen started blinking and fading. I plan on sending it back to Amazon and getting a better one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Edward Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This fish finder is really easy to use. I set it up on the trolling motor with a metal bracket rather than use the plastic one provided. Really nice screen. Probably saved my butt when I was approaching some really shallow stained water and the Garmin was showing me a little over 2 feet. I screwed the base onto a couple of pieces of wood about 14" square and about 2 1/2" thick. That way I can move it around in the boat. Really nice system for the money and extremely easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: suprano58

customer_reviews.title: I am 76 years old and not up to date with new gadets
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was a depth finder to put on my trolling motor. I was surprised the price was good and I ordered it Thursday afternoon and it came on Friday morning, that was a good surprise. My grandson helped set it up and I used it Saturday afternoon. It worked great. It gave me the speed, depth, time of day, has other features that I might not use. Also was very easy to read for as small as the screen is. I am very happy with it and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Adams

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS fishfinder for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I lost my other Garmin Striker during a move, researched other depthfinders and decided to go back with a Garmin, I mainly fish inshore and nearshore waters so I can’t justify spending 500 plus on a plotter, but I will say the GPS is accurate and very simple and useful. Marking a spot is very simple and when you are running in unfamiliar areas the GPS “breadcrumbs” comes in handy when finding your way back to the ramp! The sonar is very easy to use, simple, and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Adam HS

customer_reviews.title: Bad seller
customer_reviews.text: It went out on the second use dident work right on the first then the store refused to help me or let me return it said i had ro contact the manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: joey

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product for the price! already went out a few times in the ocean mounted n my 20' wellcraft! went as deep as few hundred feet and the color screen is awesome! Controls were very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The Best Depth Finder for my Purposes
customer_reviews.text: Have used Lowrance for kayak fishing for more than 10yrs. Have had continuous issues with Lowrance, too much negative stuff to describe on this review. Read a bunch of positive reviews on the Garmin Striker 4. I am quite pleased with the Striker 4. Its easy to set up and navigate to your particular fishing liking. Its suburb and responds quickly when depths change rapidly. Will buy again. Thanks Garmin for this excellent product - perfect for my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Mainly using this as a depth finder
customer_reviews.text: I am mainly using this a a depth finder and looking for submerged rock piles and structure. Not using the unit to locate fish currently. But it does have that capability for when I do want to use it. Love it for my kayak. Can mount it out of the way so it doesn't interfere while I am paddling. Large enough to read the details on the screen from 3-4 feet way from me.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Goldammer

customer_reviews.title: See'um & Smok'um
customer_reviews.text: For 100 bucks this thing rocks! Accurate depth & fish readings even with transducer barely in the water. Screen easy to see even in the hawaiian sun. Mounts up strong & held up to getting soaked on the side of my kayak. Connected this baby to a DBpower lithium jumper pack & it will run all day! 6 hours fishing constant on only pulled 20% of the power pack. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great transducer cable is a bit short for a pontoon speed / temp /color /GPS /locates fish /cheap
customer_reviews.author: The Jackal

customer_reviews.title: Trolling mount
customer_reviews.text: Rather than rewrite the whole review, look at my review for  . I mounted this transducer on that brushless trolling motor. Worked great within the limits of size and capability. Particularly interesting was the durability and ease of mounting the transducer on the trolling motor.. I got a whole lot of real time testing in fast turbid water where you had no warning of underwater obstacles.. Impressive mount....
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hall

customer_reviews.title: Simple old style depth finder with a few new small features!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a bit of a toss up. If all your wanting is something to tell you depth, temperature etc then this is a good unit for you.. It has alot of cool features and is built great but for a little more money you could get a downscan/sideimaging unit that can really do some damage.. All and all if your just wanting a simple unit this is great if your wanting something complex that can greatly improve fishing or diving go with a more expense unit..
customer_reviews.author: zachary

customer_reviews.title: Garmin=Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: It did not even work one single day for full without turning off. Yes I checked voltage and it did not fall below the recommended level and I used a 35ah battery. Whenever I use this, it was turning off intermittently. Apparently some dbag designed the power cord and fuse. The fuse is not encased in a waterproof housing and that itself creates all kind of corrosion problems to the power wire. Also, all the wires are of poor quality. They got one thing right and that is the first three letters of its real name GAR--BAGE!!!! bye bye to this POS company.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Tech support sucks! Tried talking to tech support and they wanted to charge me for their knowledge. Easy to use recommended YouTube to learning how to use it. Instructions were not that great. Company focused more on other languages instead of what country it’s sold in.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Great for sailing or sport fishing boats with limited power.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best GPS Sonar device ever. There are no maps but it dioes an excellent job of showing your course and trip travels. seriously if you don't know the area or have a map to work against you should not be on the water. The sonar fish finder will find minnows and whales with ease. the selective displays are really nice. the night light features are impressivly useful and make SURE YOU BUY A COVER. one issue is that there is no cutout template to surface mount the unit in the map like directions diagram
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Versatility
customer_reviews.text: I have two kayaks, one pontoon and one jon boat. This product makes it possible to switch between all four watercraft with one portable lightweight fish finder. I made my own YakAttack Cellblok to mount the Striker 4 and the YakAttack Switch Blade. The one thing I would change is installing a quick disconnect going to the transducer making it possible to use a shorter cord. That was the only reason I could not give a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Brand new and wont turn on
customer_reviews.text: After pressing the on button Garmin is displayed then screen goes black. Its not the backlight control, all other control buttons are dead. Tech support was terrible, the 800 tech line said wait time was 2 hrs 50 min. I am returning and getting a replacement but wont be here in time for fishing trip, will see if that unit will work. Quality control???
customer_reviews.author: Rick Kapp

customer_reviews.title: Worth twice the price
customer_reviews.text: I installed this to replace an ancient sonar unit that had a display with similar graphics to tetris. Garmin Striker 4 gives you serious tech for the price. It is very customizable as far as sensitivity/gain, 77khz or 200khz, chirp vs no chirp, and the color options are good. Seriously upgraded the jon boat.
customer_reviews.author: keith naulty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fly-in rig.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my fly in fishing Canada trip. Wouldn't have done near as well without it. Easy to navigate and bright display. I used a chunk of plywood to mount base to, the Velcro to mount to boat bench. Same with battery. Used peice of plastic conduit and c clamp to mount transducer to boat. Would have bought a suction cup for transducer if I would have planned better and had more time. Nice that it can mount to electric trolling motor too.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Iverson

customer_reviews.title: Like all the features and color screen
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older model Hummingbird with this transducer and I am pretty much impressed so far. I don’t think it shows the fish as well as my Hummingbird did, but then again I may not have the settings exactly right (I just installed it on my pontoon about two weeks ago and only have used it twice). However I do really like all the features and the color screen. I think it will be a good unit once I figure everything out.
customer_reviews.author: Tomfooter

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Got it, hooked it up, took it out on my 12' inflateable boat. This fish finder worked great 1st time out, simple layout of controls, easy to navigate the menu and get right to using. Another feature i liked is it shows me the battery voltage so I knew the battery condition with my trolling motor running. Really happy with this purchase and it has a great price point. No rating on tech support because I havent used it.
customer_reviews.author: bret salley

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month of use
customer_reviews.text: First of when i first got the item it takes a while to turn it on, everything is installed correctly with my battery but after a few uses the screen just shuts off and has no power whatsoever, my battery is charged and its new. I was really dissapointed i like how small it is and perfect fit for my kayak but now i cant even use it anymore. I dont know if this a product defect but i was hoping i could get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to install and the price was great. I would suggest if your not handy and don't know anything about electronics get someone to install it for you. You need to put screws through the stern of your boat and seal it with caulk. Than run the wire to the front near your steering wheel and connect it to an electric source. The Garmin Striker 4 is an outstanding product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pasold

customer_reviews.title: This items started having problems after just a few times of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year ago and only used it a few times screen started clouding up when you first turn it on and then would clear up .Thought maybe the sun was doing this was mounted on my party barge with a hardtop.after trying to use it a few times this year now the screen is all blacked out. Wasted my money on this and now have to buy another one but will no buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: nice entry level unit
customer_reviews.text: hard to complain for the price, but definitely an entry level device. U wanted it for my kayak but didnt want to spend a lot. This was fine for a season but if you're like me you'll want a bigger screen and more features rather quickly. Going from no fish finder to this us a big upgrade, but it left me wanting more and i upgraded to a 7" with maps after the first year
customer_reviews.author: SurfCaster

customer_reviews.title: Faulty product
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this depth finder. They are faulty. I’ve gone through 2 units now. The first one I purchased through Academy and it failed within 5 minutes on the water. The second one I bought through amazon and it failed after the third full day of use. Now I’m going through farming warranty to get it replaced. The third one will probably fail as well. Yes I’ve checked the fuse with an ohm meter and I’m getting 12v to the power cable. Unit is dead. Won’t turn on. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little color unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: For around $100 i thought well this cant be all that great, but i didnt care and tried it anyways. Wow! Amazing color, seems very accurate, easy to use and navigate. I only use it for depth and get a kick out of seeing fish, but theres more options to it i havent used. I had a marina install it and they said it wasnt hard, typical install whatever thats worth.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Horse

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little unit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little unit. Best bang for your buck under 100 bucks!! I made a portable box for it so I can take it from canoe to boat to ice fishing. Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent...
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on the on high priced units that it takes a doctor's degree to understand....This is a very good unit ....Very good for the pontoon boat..........gps, fish finder depth....easy to read........plus , plus...on the Tennessee river...Rjr
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie J Roe

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and navigate through the icons
customer_reviews.text: It looks good. The screen is bright enough to use in sunlight. Easy to use. I turned it on, got into the settings to shut off the demo mode and I was on my way. It gives depth, water temp, marks fish and gives you boat speed. It is also capable to drop a marker using the GPS(which I have not done yet). Good device at an inexpensive price
customer_reviews.author: wphil10600

customer_reviews.title: Use it for structure and you'll find the fish.will be near....
customer_reviews.text: for a small boat it helps fing structure and fish. I use it for structure though. I was very happy with the monitor small but if you know what your looking at it works fine. I mounted ming on a peice of plywood and it sits right on the seat in front of me and sees the botton in a small lake near the house.
customer_reviews.author: Harlem grill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this amazing Farin fish finder. I read many reviews and decided for this one. And within my budget. Its looks great on my Sun Dolphin Sportsman 10. I will tested it in the water later. I connected mine transducer in the trolling motor. Futures are easy to ses thanks to the great reviews in you tub. Fast cheaping and well packed, Will highly recommend it, Will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Maximino Laboy

customer_reviews.title: Still in the box unable to use. It maybe spectacular just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Just call me stupid we couldn’t figure out to use this, still not hooked up. Can’t find anyone that has a clue how to hook it up
customer_reviews.author: Sharbug

customer_reviews.title: Power cord
customer_reviews.text: Big problems with power cord. On it's own line from the battery so it's not the operator. Returned it for another one and the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but need something more detailed
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin has no maps waypoints to setup before leaving the house . It stopped working this year only used it twice. Hopefully I can return it and get another type with charts and everything
customer_reviews.author: Brian Denithorne

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive and works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is very intuitive. The GPS tells me speed over ground and has helped me get back to areas I could not have found my way back to. Be aware there are no maps, so you just see a white screen with a dotted trail of where you have been.
customer_reviews.author: Bret C.

customer_reviews.title: But I love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used it on two hour long outings to mess around with the settings. But I love it so far. I'll be using it ice fishing this winter too so I will update my review then.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and install.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this striker 4 for kayak fishing. It works great and was simple to install the transducer through a scupper hole. I did have to make a mount for it to install through the scupper hole but that was simple with a couple youtube videos. Overall I'm very happy I purchased this fish finder.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: I love this fishfinder
customer_reviews.text: I love this fishfinder. Very easy to install. Fits perfect on my Nayive Ultimate 12. Love the clarity of the color screen.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Installed quickly and easily. GPS, speed, water temp, and depth.  Cover sold separately.
customer_reviews.text: Installed quickly and easily. So far no issues. I don’t understand why the dim button is also the power button; took me a while to figure that out while on the water. I like that it has gps, speed, depth, water temp, and time/date on display.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are very unclear
customer_reviews.text: So I haven't actually used this on the water yet, but I did install it yesterday and that was quite the challenge. There is almost no instructions on how to install/set up this unit. I pretty much guessed my way through installing this on my kayak. Hopefully when I try it on the water this weekend it works okay...
customer_reviews.author: Trey Alexander Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Love it but had some trouble understanding the instruction on ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it but had some trouble understanding the instruction on GPS. Good Price and really shows up good in bright light.
customer_reviews.author: dwight

customer_reviews.title: Not good product
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for first month going to have to replace it already
customer_reviews.author: trudian

customer_reviews.title: Garmin fish finder ! Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Installed this fish finder on my 2002 Fourwinds Freedom 170 and work great we are very happy with this product only down the keypad don’t have backlight you can see the buttons at night but other that that really happy
customer_reviews.author: Ray 566

customer_reviews.title: perfect little fish finder
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast, i have it on a 16 ft lund and it is the perfect little campaniion for the occasional fisherman like me even easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband on Father’s Day. We used it for the first time on the river and it was perfect. We weren’t very familiar with the river and this helped us navigate and avoid the low water spots. I also bought the protective cover to go with it and it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Mattie

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Use it on our little bass boat. Easy to read and colorful. Marks fish and underwater structure. We have a larger Garmin for our bigger boat and we love it too. Garmin customer support is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Not for saltwater use
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to fish Puget Sound, where depths frequently exceed 400FOW. Unfortunately, this device fails whenever I paddle into water deeper than ~400'; the failure pattern is typified by the unit showing no depth, and the screen displaying only static. The failure continues when I paddle into more shallow water. This product consistently renders me blind, and is a great disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna S.

customer_reviews.title: How much would it cost to get it fixed?
customer_reviews.text: I don't get to use it for a while , took it to new York lake s oneida worked great for a while then it went black VERY Disipointed with this product ......... Rudy rudeman69@gmail.com any help would be appreciated 856 357 1550
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Levoch

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive fish finder..
customer_reviews.text: This is all you need to find fish. It’s very affordable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Harlan H. mote

customer_reviews.title: Installed it on my kayak and works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kayak and based on everyone's reviews on Amazon and YouTube. Super easy install and it's very easy to use. Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Drew from Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Good fish finder for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Only had it out one time for about 2 hrs....weather was bad. I like it so far, seems to do a lot more than my older Humminbird. It at least showed fish arches. As far as accuracy, not sure. So far I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Find out why it's not working
customer_reviews.text: Had product just under 6 months it turns on but no display troubleshoot nothing works try to call their service and it's a two-hour hold and then they hang up is there anyone out there that can help us
customer_reviews.author: meriel

customer_reviews.title: Good and accurate product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband's birthday. He realky enjoys it . It seems to be very accurate. We have used it about 2 times so far it has been a great help locating the areas that the fish are mostly in.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Berrios

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Truly great unit! It was super easy to install (if mechanically inclined) so far it’s been very good and I find it to be extremely accurate! Well worth the price and then some!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a great product but has program issues
customer_reviews.text: When I try to turn the unit off it takes 2 pushes on the on / off button and the second button reduces the back-light brightness to night mode. This causes to reduce the light the next time you turn the device on. The images are not visible in daylight conditions, hence you think there is no power. The default lighting should be brighter every time the unit is turned on. Poor and inadequate programming and testing.
customer_reviews.author: Marty H.

customer_reviews.title: Great depth finder/GPS
customer_reviews.text: I use this depth finder to fish for crappi and to mark places I have found crappi this is a great little depth finder I put it on a 16 ft Jon boat and it's is very accurate and has a great picture easy to use and mark spots and helps you get back to those exact spots
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Basic GPS
customer_reviews.text: Very basic GPS. It's good for marking spots/ramps/trails but sometimes the coordinates will randomly shift and show your island in the middle of the water. I would spend the money on a better GPS with land/structure already on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have to be knowledgeable about it
customer_reviews.text: It only works for kayaks, canoes. Metal fishing boats.. but you couldnt tell that from the description, or that it's some of these are only for salt water or fresh water.. 🤷🏻‍♀️.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Great budget/beginner fish finder
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for a low budget fish finder. I mainly use it for water depth but it's useful for finding under water objects. Durable with a deflective design.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon White

customer_reviews.title: Works great in a kayak
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one last winter for my kayak and really enjoyed using it this year so this one was for my wives. We were able to get them out a couple of weeks ago and she loved it
customer_reviews.author: e dearborn

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy. Quality and affordability.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect kayak finder. Lightweight and easy to use. No frills easy controls and easy viewing in direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Sqwiddy

customer_reviews.title: My husband was surprise with it's clarity and how user ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband was surprise with it's clarity and how user friendly it is. This is the first one that he will take it off the boat when not in use. Price was reasonable, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jodee

customer_reviews.title: The fish are jumping in the boat!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a fish finder! Was easy to mount the transducer, and the bracket to hold the unit. I would recommend getting the Transducer mounting plate if you don’t want to drill into your hull. Works great and the instructions are clear.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Good simple buy for price
customer_reviews.text: It works well the way. Stuff just sucks and I don’t exactly understand the frequencies quite yet it shows no fish sometimes when there’s fish but that’s Fishing
customer_reviews.author: Rastatam

customer_reviews.title: Haven't run aground since
customer_reviews.text: Purchased more for the depth vs fish finder. DIY install...no leaks. Installed on 19' bay boat with limited console space. Great fit and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Adams

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: So far I’ve had this for a little over a year. It has been a great, easy to use. I find myself turning it on even just when going out with the family simply to check clearance. Have done some good fishing with it. Would recommend it for a inexpensive option. I didn't give it five stars because I would have liked a better stand for it.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: If your putting this in a larger boat you will need a power cable extension.
customer_reviews.text: The only fishfinder you’ll ever NEED. Works amazon, color scheme is perfect! If you’re on the fence with this, get it. I rarely put reviews on amazon but after 2 days of fishing with this I tell all of my friends this is what they need.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: No operating instructions
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work good, but no instructions included. I’m getting better with it each time, but I’m no tech wiz either. Good product for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: The price is great, even less than just a depth finder. It provided accurate depth and water temperature at low speed, but did have an echo line and lost depth reading over 20mph
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday to put on his new boat and by far it’s his favorite electronic',! It shows the depth your speed and most importantly the fish! When you buy it don’t forget to buy the rechargeable battery!Its great also! Happy fishing!
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I have not used all of the features. I have mainly used it for depth finding, water temp, and sometimes to locate fish. Not good at locating fish yet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not so hot
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this thing. Too aggravating to use. If you put it on day mode, you can't see a thing. Too late to send back. Junk in my book
customer_reviews.author: monk

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece of equipment. Cant wait for the Ice Fishing trip. Will add more to the review when that is done. So far this thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Carlton

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate wires
customer_reviews.text: The power wire broke from the fuse in the first hour. Why is it so brittle? No map on the GPS function when it was working. WTF Garmin?
customer_reviews.author: sara cribbins

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really needed just for knowing depth. Works perfect and the GPS included is great for saving spots where I catch. Dual band screen is nice addition and shows fish.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Great product, used for ice fishing took some trial and error,but worked good
customer_reviews.author: tony verley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for big water kayak fishing
customer_reviews.text: Been using for 2 years now on my fishing kayak. Super durable, accurate, easy to use and unbeatable price point I dont write many reviews but this product deserves 5 stars. Helpwd me locate and land walleye, steelhead, lunker bass, crappie, and even musky. Used also for ice fishing.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Kayak bass fishing
customer_reviews.text: bought this and fitted it to my kayak for bass fishing in California. Works great and i've been able to mark fish and then catch them. Great entry level unit and perfect for the kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good Fish Finder
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this one time but was impressed with it. I still haven't used all the features it has but will as I learn more about it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Tilley

customer_reviews.title: I used ice fishing, never had an issue. ...
customer_reviews.text: I used ice fishing, never had an issue. This summer it is getting mounted in my kayak, if the lakes up here ever melt...
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Product looks good
customer_reviews.text: My husband will be using this in JAMAICA I cannot comment on the product until it has been u
customer_reviews.author: violet   mccallum

customer_reviews.title: dead after one year
customer_reviews.text: after coming out of storage product is dead will not turn on. contacted garmin did all the steps over phone with them took about 20 min to test everything. unit is junk and of course I didn't buy the extended warranty and cant return it. not happy about product
customer_reviews.author: rodney scruggs

customer_reviews.title: Screen pops in and out of darkness
customer_reviews.text: So far depths work good. Did get a replacement turning off and on by it self and screen goes dark. So far the second is working well
customer_reviews.author: Deb

product_meta.title: Garmin 010-01550-00 Striker 4 with Transducer, 3.5" GPS Fishfinder with Chirp Traditional Transducer
product_meta.description: Style:SingleFollowing in the success of the Striker fishfinder series, Garmin is proud to announce the new Striker fishfinders with ClearVu technology. These devices are designed to allow you to mark your favorite fishing spot and easily navigate back to it tomorrow, saving you time and money. Striker series fishfinders are available in 3.5-, 5- and 7-inch display sizes. Display resolution: 480 x 320 pixels.
feature_bullets: Clear Vu scanning Sonar shows you more of what is in the water around your boat; This high frequency sonar gives near photographic images with detailed representations of objects, structure and fish
The power of simple offers a keyed interface with dedicated buttons; The device is easy to use and easy to install; Available in 3.5, 5 and 7 inch display sizes; Water rating IPX7

Waypoint map: Use the way point map to easily view, mark and navigate to locations such as brush piles, stumps and docks; Maximum depth 1,600 feet freshwater, 750 feet saltwater; Current draw at 12 volt: 0.23 Ampere
Chirp Sonar sends a continuous sweep of frequencies which provides a wider range of information; Chirp Sonar is able to create crisper fish arches with better target separation

Built in flasher: View your sonar data in the classic flasher format; Ideal for ice fishing or vertical jigging. Display size: 1.9 x 2.9 inches (4.9 x 7.3 centimeter); 3.5 inches diagonal (8.7 centimeter)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,685 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Transducer, Transom and motor mounts, STRIKER 4 fishfinder, Documentation, Power/data cable, Tilt/swivel mount
